transcript: Hello everyone, welcome to the Bumingbai Podcast. I am the host Yuan Li. China’s official statistics say that GDP will grow by 5.2% in 2023 , but this is not in line with the experience of most Chinese people. Everyone is full of questions and anxieties about the economic future . In the first issue, we invited Professor Xu Chenggang from Stanford University to answer some questions of common concern . For example, how bad will the Chinese economy get if it continues to deteriorate? Will it collapse? How might it collapse? If the economy continues to decline, how resilient or fragile will the CCP’s rule be? Many middle-class people are terrified, afraid of falling into poverty again. Will this happen on a large scale? What can ordinary Chinese people do to prepare? Also, if China's economy continues to weaken, what impact will it have on the world economy? What should the world do to prepare? Xu Chenggang is a senior fellow at the Center for China Economics and Institutions at Stanford University and a visiting professor at Imperial College London. His research focuses on political economy, institutional economics and transition economics . Hello Teacher Xu, China’s official statistics say that GDP will grow by 5.2% in 2023. Do you think this data is reliable? Which of these official statistics will still be of reference value in the future? This data is unreliable. The reason is very simple because it also comes from official data. We know that China’s unemployment rate is rising significantly, especially the unemployment rate among young people. Official reports have exceeded 20% . According to economists from Peking University, Their survey report is more than 40%. When the unemployment rate is so large and the unemployment rate is growing rapidly, it is in direct conflict with an economic growth of 5%. Another official data is China's overall foreign trade. It has declined over the past few decades. The growth of foreign trade has always been one of the most important driving forces for China's GDP growth. The driving force is now negative. Another official statistics is that China's entire real estate industry is declining. Statistics over the years tell us that the upstream and downstream sectors of the real estate industry and the real estate industry itself together account for roughly one-third of China's GDP. When this field is declining as a whole, when it is negative , it also makes 5% of the GDP. GDP growth is unbelievable because if the real estate industry drops significantly and foreign trade also drops, if you expect GDP to grow, you must find a particularly big bright spot, which sector has particularly strong growth. Of course, it is official There is also a media report saying that China has three new technologies this year. The three new technologies are electric vehicles, batteries, and green energy. But all in all, the total value generated by these three fields is far lower than the value of the real estate industry , and the official report What is more prominent about these three things is how remarkable the growth of these three things in foreign trade is. But in fact, they only account for only 3% of the entire foreign trade. This is a very small proportion and the entire foreign trade is negative. So putting all these together, we know that the officially reported growth rate of 5% is unreliable. Which official data released in the past are of reference value? The first is foreign trade . The reason is that foreign trade must If the figures from other countries are comparable, they cannot be too different. Another one is the unemployment rate , but the official unemployment rate has now stopped being released. So when the official stops releasing the unemployment rate, there is no way. There is also the long-term Chinese official There are also problems with the statistical caliber of the unemployment rate because a huge number of unemployed people in China are so-called migrant workers , and its statistics refer to counting people with urban household registration. Therefore, its statistical caliber itself determines that it can cover up the basic social phenomenon of a large number of unemployed migrant workers . If in the future we also see that the youth unemployment rate has not been released for a while and then it is released, it means that there are some so-called students in school. Anyway, the caliber has changed later and there are other data no matter where they are. The government or the central government announces less and less , and it becomes more and more unreliable. How can we know China's economic situation? And you probably think that China's GDP should be positive or negative in 2023 last year? From the data obtained through channels, we can guess that the economic growth rate in 2023 will be about the same as zero. The most likely rate will be slightly higher than zero and lower than 1% . The most likely rate will be between zero and 1% in this range. The reason for the growth rate of a few tenths is that one is the fundamental data, which is the national road logistics. Generally speaking, the growth of the national road logistics in 23 years is about this order of magnitude compared to 22 years , which is a little more than zero . One is the foreign trade I just talked about. Foreign trade is a little lower than zero , but not much lower. So if you put these things together, it will probably be like this. The other is the stock market. China’s stock market has never truly reflected China. economy , but the stock market at least reflects the sentiment of investors, that is, when the fundamentals are very poor, investor sentiment determines the stock market. The sentiment of the entire stock market is very poor. I am looking at the Shanghai stock market in China, and the Shanghai Composite Index in 2007. At that time, it reached almost 6,000 points. Then in 2015, it reached a peak of more than 5,100 points . Now it is almost at 2,800 points. In fact, it is similar to what it was in 2007 and 2008. Anyway, the Chinese stock market has not been rising. It was said at the work meeting that we should prevent financial crises. Do you think China can avoid financial crises? What will the government do to avoid or delay the occurrence of financial crises? If China is a market economy , then China's current fundamentals and China's current financial situation The reason why China's financial crisis is almost difficult to avoid is because there are very huge problems in the real estate market and the problems brought by the real estate market to the whole of China's finance , because in the whole of China's finance, a large number of loans are based on real estate assets. For mortgages , when the real estate market as a whole goes down, the asset part of the balance sheet of all banks that issue real estate mortgage assets will shrink. When their assets shrink, their balance sheets will shrink. If something goes wrong , if something goes wrong, the bank will collapse. When a bank fails, there will be a chain reaction. This is a financial crisis. But if it is a non-market economy , in fact, this problem can be covered up and overcome . This could not have happened in China. In the past, China was not a market economy. China did not have the financial phenomenon that everyone can see. So at that time, China could be very bad, very bad, and tens of millions of people could starve to death. However, this phenomenon did not happen in North Korea. This was also the case with the Soviet Union in the past. This was also the case with the communist countries of Central and Eastern Europe in the past. Therefore, when it takes preventing financial risks as its highest task , it can completely abandon the market economy when it has no choice but to achieve its goals. Then why does Xi Jinping still say that we need to prevent financial crises? It is exactly this system. It is a closed system. Then why does he want to talk about this? Because they still hope that there will be a financial market. They also hope that China will have a market. China has these three Forty years of economic reform have allowed them to see that the difference between the economic reforms in China and the Soviet Union and Central and Eastern Europe is that China has the development of this market . Their market socialism is that all state-owned enterprises have no private enterprises at all, and they eventually collapsed . They still want to preserve this market economy , but if there is no market economy in the world, there will be no financial crisis. It is the phenomenon that financial crisis and market economy are combined. This basic system is called the market. Financial crisis is a phenomenon that the market economy is highly efficient . There is an important mechanism in this high efficiency, which is the crisis. In fact, the market economy is highly efficient, but there is an indispensable factor in it. The most basic mechanism missing is bankruptcy. When a sporadic individual enterprise goes bankrupt, it is not a crisis. When a series of enterprises, especially financial enterprises, go bankrupt, it is a financial crisis . Then the market economy cannot escape without bankruptcy. If the financial crisis is not eliminated , then all the government can do in a market economy is to try to reduce the impact of the financial crisis. However, no government can avoid the financial crisis. So what measures do you think the Chinese government will take next? What will be the cost of avoiding or delaying the financial crisis and the government's cost of doing this? Who will pay the price in the future? In fact, what we have been working hard to do in these years is to freeze the market , at least partially. The frozen market in some places is completely frozen. The frozen market. What I mean here is the real estate market. It does not allow the real estate market to reduce prices. This is frozen because real estate assets in this market can no longer be sold. When there is no market for the real estate products to be sold. The only way is to lower the price. The market must be like this , but if you don't allow it to lower the price, you are freezing it. If you don't allow it to lower the price, then on the surface, what we just talked about is a chain reaction. If you allow it to lower the price , then all the following If the real estate market is used as a mortgage asset and placed on the bank's balance sheet, there will be problems . If it freezes it, then on the surface it seems that my financial system will not be affected . As long as you let it go, it will be affected. Then when you After using this method, it means that your real estate company cannot sell its products . This will cause your real estate company to be unable to repay the debts it originally owed . In fact, you will not be able to sell your real estate. If you lose you, there will be no income , and your assets will shrink . Then the debt you owe will be repaid. In the end, the real estate company will become insolvent . This real estate company will go bankrupt. In fact, it has happened to Evergrande , and now Country Garden is in danger . A series of large real estate companies are very dangerous. On the one hand, they are using the method we just mentioned to freeze the market. On the other hand, they have also discovered that if these large real estate companies go bankrupt, there will be a chain reaction. So if you freeze the market, you will be in trouble. On the other hand, there is a chain reaction , so now they are asking banks to directly grant them loans and find ways to save them. This problem has returned to a common problem in all communist countries. This common problem is called soft budget constraints. So soft budget constraints Originally it refers to this kind of market socialist economy , in which state-owned enterprises operate in the market. In fact, state-owned enterprises operate in the market and do not obey the laws of the market. The biggest aspect of their disobedience to the laws of the market is when they become insolvent. It is not bankrupt because the country will save it. Now, for example, Country Garden is not a state-owned enterprise , but now the government treats it as a state-owned enterprise because it has found that if it goes bankrupt, the impact will be too great when it is this large-scale. When using rescue methods to rescue these insolvent companies, this comprehensive soft budget constraint will bring very serious consequences , just like the problems faced by the communist countries in Central and Eastern Europe in the Soviet Union in the past . Hello everyone, My name is Yuan Li. There is a team effort behind the wonderful conversation you just heard. Thank you to those listeners who have actively donated. Now there are two ways to say it. One is that China’s economy already has systemic problems , such as local debt, real estate, bubbles, and other policies of the Xi Jinping regime, which have only accelerated the development of these problems. Another theory is that China itself has these systemic problems, but every major Economies such as Japan and the United States have many problems , but a series of actions by the Xi Jinping regime have completely failed the regulatory function of the Chinese economy. The economic situation could have been less bleak, and the recession could have been less tragic. What do you think of these two statements ? The problems in China's economy are not caused by one person but by China's system . However, China's system is basically different from the systems of the United States and Japan, so it cannot be compared with them because the United States and Japan are both market economies based on private ownership. A democratic system is the rule of law. The meaning of the rule of law is that the courts are independent of the party. Courts are independent of the administrative department of the government. Chinese courts are tools for the party to execute orders. In this case, this system has brought about all the problems we have seen . Including what I just said , here I need to highlight one more aspect. In addition to the one aspect I just mentioned, which is the state ownership of all land and the state ownership of the entire banking system , this is the basic feature of the Communist Party system. We have seen serious problems in the real estate market. The problems we have seen in the stock market and the problems we have seen in the entire economy are actually inseparable from the complete state ownership of land, the complete state ownership of banks , and the judiciary is a tool of the party and cannot be separated from all these. The problems brought about by these basic systems have led to China's economy, which has actually been very stable and declining year by year since the global financial crisis. As a general trend, China is not the only one. In the past, the Soviet Union and Central and Eastern Europe All communist countries have experienced a gradual decline, which eventually reached a point where it was slower than the growth rate of the capitalist economy . Xi Jinping’s regime has accelerated the decline. His role is to speed up the decline. Originally, it would have declined steadily. Now suddenly , especially after the epidemic, the dynamic clearing policy pushed down the growth rate very quickly. Then the actual economic growth rate in 2022 should be negative . It is not just a decline in growth rate, but even a decline in 2022. Of course , he has always said that the state will advance and the people will retreat , but during his term of office, he engaged in mixed ownership , suppressed Internet companies, and so- called real estate companies. Three red lines , and then there is the education and training industry, which is being destroyed one by one. They use the words on the Internet to say that some people, especially people in the corporate world, will feel that we could not be so miserable. We are still in the corporate world. If it's running well, then this person comes up. Taking all of us is like saying that if the table is lifted, everyone will not be able to eat. But according to your feeling, the meal was originally slow and there was no need to eat. He just lifted the table all at once . I don’t know what to do. What would you say to these people? You must have many people asking you this question. In fact, this question is that we need to understand why he does this. We need to understand from the most fundamental point. What will people do if he does this ? I think it's very strange that these private enterprises are the geese that lay golden eggs . So why would he kill the goose if he wanted the golden eggs ? It's very strange when you think of it simply as managing the economy. But he is absolutely The original purpose of the economic reforms of the Communist Party of China is not just for the economy. No leader of the CCP would think that it is just for the economy. No leader of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union or Eastern and Central Europe would think that his economic reforms are just for the economy. For the sake of economic and economic reform, it is for his regime. The problem below is why he wants to do these things for his regime. In fact, they feel that the development of these private enterprises threatens his rule. This is the key point. When he thinks When these private enterprises threaten his rule, he will get rid of whoever poses the greatest threat first . For example, the so-called education and training industry. Originally, the Communist Party fully rules the entire education field. The entire education field needs to be under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Education . The Ministry of Education is an institution of the Communist Party , and these private enterprises in the education and training industry have separated from the Ministry of Education . They don’t know what you are teaching , and they think that you are actually working with the Communist Party in the field of education and ideology. If you are trying to grab territory , I will shut down all of you and be done with it. I have repeatedly emphasized that in the Chinese economy, the entire land and entire banks are state-owned, state- owned, and owned by the party. And Ant Financial is not state-owned. Ant Financial is not party-owned. As a financial institution, if this listing is successful, it will become the largest listing in history . It is clear that once it becomes a bank-like institution, it has actually become a competition with all state-owned banks for resources and territory . This is directly from the perspective of the Communist Party, and it is shaking the Communist Party's rule from the foundation. This is not allowed on the basis of this , so whether it is in this way or other ways, even if it is listed, the party will take it over, which is impossible to leave the party's rule. Such an important financial institution cannot be separated from the party's leadership. The leadership of the party is not false. It does not mean that I listen to the party. That is not okay. It is not that I listen to the party. The party directly wants to control this. This is a party institution . So the truth is that as long as everyone knows how the Communist Party leads the country, the Communist Party is How to lead the economy? Once you understand this principle , the logic of everything the Communist Party does will be clear. If the economy continues to deteriorate like this, to what extent will it deteriorate ? In what way will it collapse ? The questions I asked you today are all questions that various people came to me to ask. They must have run to me and more people must have run to ask you whether the economy is actually in ruins. This is actually true. People will have different understandings under different systems and under different backgrounds. If this is an open society , an open social market economy and a democratic system , then when your economy obviously declines, the unemployment rate rises sharply and the stock market rises sharply. If the amplitude decreases , everyone will say that it has collapsed. Then you will elect the current leader during the election. Then the current leader is on the one hand the leader and on the other hand the party he belongs to. The party will lose This vote means another party is going to come up , so this is a democratic system, so this is because you have ruined the economy, but if you are in a closed society, especially in a totalitarian system, then in a totalitarian system the voices are all The ideology of control is controlled, and the information is controlled. When this totalitarian rule believes that economic-related speech has threatened the rule of his regime , then he will ban all economic-related speech and ban all economic-related speech. The data will be seen by people , so this is not a hypothesis, it is not just logic, it all happened. For example, during the three-year famine in China, the famine in all regions was not allowed to be exposed. No one was exposed even if the local people were exposed. Famine in a very small place is a crime. This crime is punishable by imprisonment. This is why during the three years of famine and even after the famine, during the Cultural Revolution, the vast majority of urban people had no idea that tens of millions of people starved to death in China. All places where people starve to death only know that people starve to death in their own place. He never knows other places . Then he knows that people starve to death in his own place and he dare not tell others that my place once starved to death. In this case If everyone can endure this economy, it will not collapse. In fact, China is not the only country to have major famines. Ukraine was the country where major famines occurred in the 1930s. During the Soviet rule, major famines occurred in North Korea many times, and many people died of starvation. But he did not collapse, and he persisted, so whether he will collapse actually depends very much on people's consensus and the flow of information. Another specific example is the collapse of the communist countries in Eastern and Central Europe in 1989 , and the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1992 . Why did they collapse ? In fact, if we simply look at their economy, they were far from as miserable as China's three-year famine, far from as miserable as North Korea today. But why did they collapse ? The reason why they collapsed is because They have experienced over 20 years of very failed economic reforms The extremely failed economic reforms of more than 20 years have created a consensus among economists in these countries, among their social elites, including the top leaders of their Communist Party. This consensus is that this system cannot be reformed , so if we want to reform the economy, we must first reform it. What is this system ? This system cannot be reformed . It is a system that prohibits private enterprises. What prohibits private enterprises is that the Communist Party prohibits private enterprises. Therefore, they believe that the rule of the Communist Party cannot continue. Only by ending the rule of the Communist Party can the private economy develop . And this private sector Economic development is never purely an economic issue. The development of the private economy is about whether everyone's basic rights are recognized. Can people own property? When everyone's rights are basically recognized, of course this conflicts with the most basic principles of the Communist Party. This is the consensus formed in their country. Under this consensus , then his system will collapse. When people do not have this consensus , when this business is prohibited , then even hungry people will tighten their belts and get through it . That is now. What North Korea looks like , that is to say, how tenacious or fragile the CCP’s rule is when the economy is not good depends on what kind of consensus China has at least achieved among the Chinese elite, so do they have this consensus ? Can you realize that the problem of his basic system must be changed? This is not a problem of one person, not a problem of several people around a person. When the situation gets worse, of course, a very important part here is that savings are savings and they face a big risk. Inflation . Savings are inflation and all people’s savings are wiped out . What actually happened was that hyperinflation suddenly occurred in the Soviet Union and Eastern and Central European countries when the communist regime collapsed. This hyper-inflation is actually because there is already so much currency in the economy. What this brings is that there are already so many bad debts, which are supported by these currencies and have been issued. Once this thing comes out, you can see the consequences. It just didn't explode in the past. Once it broke out, it was actually a problem accumulated in the past. Now we know that in order to support these enterprises and support these banks, The currency they want to issue to support them is trillions, ten trillions, tens of trillions, because the debt they owe now is hundreds of trillions, so in the end, you have to withstand it to prevent this from collapsing. If the financial system does not collapse, if the financial system does not collapse, then the amount of currency you actually need is a figure of one hundred trillion, one trillion, one trillion. Once this number breaks out, it will be incredible inflation, so it will be accelerated inflation. Or explosive inflation , it is difficult to predict when it will come. China is still facing the difficulty of deflation due to severe insufficient domestic demand and overcapacity. Sooner or later, it will suddenly turn around again. Sooner or later, this thing is going to explode . Basically, ordinary people have no choice but to wait and wait for this storm. For it , if it is not a physical asset owned by loans , for example, real estate, it is quite capable of resisting hyperinflation. Some people say that the CCP still has a lot of cards , but it is not there yet. Type it out, what do you think of this statement? The reason why a financial crisis occurs is because there is no liquidity. None of the state-owned assets we are talking about now are liquid. They are all real estate.
